Under Section 51 of the Lisbon treaty, foreign nationals being arrested or detained abroad within Europe must show "reasonable legal certainty" that they will avoid being extradited. The process of being tried in their native country is usually lengthy, but it is often accompanied by a court hearing or trial. Foreign nationals can seek to have the court sentence them to 15 to 23 months – in many countries – whereas the government says a court sentence is only temporary for their alleged offences.
